Versions: Eclipse 3.0 final, AJDT 1.1.10

I quit Eclipse with several closed projects (plain Java and C++) and one AspectJ
project open. The Aspect J project is not dependent on any other project.

When I restart Eclipse, I get the following error for the first closed project
(this is a C++ project):

buildOptionsAdapter.exceptionDuringRetrieve. Reason: Project ... is not open
NullPointerException

From the .log


!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 372 Jun 28, 2004 14:01:09.925
!MESSAGE Resource /ABHFELD C Parser is not open.

(message 'Resource /ABHFELD C Parser is not open' repeated several times)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ajdt.ui 4 0 Jun 28, 2004 14:01:09.925
!MESSAGE NullPointerException thrown: null
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.ajdt.internal.ui.ajde.ProjectProperties.getSourcePathResources(ProjectProperties.java:744)
	at
org.aspectj.ajde.internal.CompilerAdapter.configureProjectOptions(CompilerAdapter.java:502)
	at
org.aspectj.ajde.internal.CompilerAdapter.genBuildConfig(CompilerAdapter.java:155)
	at org.aspectj.ajde.internal.CompilerAdapter.compile(CompilerAdapter.java:83)
	at
org.aspectj.ajde.internal.AspectJBuildManager$CompilerThread.run(AspectJBuildManager.java:165)

I did not succeedd in reproducing this bug on pre-release AJDT 1.1.11. The 
function where the NPE happened does not get called at all on startup. I hope 
this means we got rid of the bug in the new version which is not that unlikely 
because we have changed quiet a few things.

Dirk, please could confirm whether the problem is fixed with AJDT 1.1.11 when
you get the chance?
Thanks,
Matt.
Yes, it is fixed with version 1.1.11.
